pr_title: Query Breakdown: Deletion implemented, version 1 of input parsing complete, loop sketched

timeline.message: first sketch of the entire project
input text file can be parsed by the program
added multiple line file test, branch testing
input text file can be parsed by the program
added multiple line file test, branch testing
changed package, finished draft of loop function
added additional parser testing, added findnthindex function

timeline.bodyText:
The logic seems wrong here. Seems it should be
if (args[0] == null) {
timeline.author: feiling

replies.bodyText: I think the logic here was that if an argument was provided, the variable would be initialized. I maintained the same logic for my new code--let me know if this is wrong!
replies.author: subinbean
feiling

replies.bodyText: Gotcha, I changed the code in main.java to reflect the CLI interface, so I do believe the current way should resolve this issue. Resolving for now!
replies.author: subinbean

timeline.bodyText: When this happens, shouldn't you need to throw an exception to stop the execution?
timeline.author: feiling
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -17,19 +21,24 @@ public static void main(String[] args) {
       System.out.println("You have not specified the input file");

timeline.author: feiling

timeline.bodyText: The code can be simplified by calling readAllLines.
timeline.author: feiling

timeline.bodyText: Please create a work item to use a library such as http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-cli/ to process command line args
timeline.author: feiling

timeline.bodyText: Use an enum instead of boolean for errorHandlingType.
timeline.author: feiling

replies.bodyText: Hopefully resolved with the most recent commit!
replies.author: subinbean

timeline.bodyText: should we make it a final field?
timeline.author: AayushBhatnagar

timeline.bodyText: Why not first replace and then substring? In this case you end up doing substring, replace and append.
timeline.author: AayushBhatnagar
AayushBhatnagar

replies.bodyText: left as package private for now as sort of a "test hook." Will address privacy settings later.
replies.author: subinbean

replies.bodyText: can you please add a comment in the code explaining the justification of extended visibility of the function?
replies.author: AayushBhatnagar

replies.bodyText: yup, it's more of a comment that's applicable for the entire class so just added a comment above the entire thing
replies.author: subinbean

timeline.bodyText: If all methods are static, then why these fields are not static?
timeline.author: AayushBhatnagar
AayushBhatnagar

replies.bodyText: I can still see this return statement. can you please remove it first?
replies.author: AayushBhatnagar

replies.bodyText: yikes, my bad--should be removed now
replies.author: subinbean

timeline.bodyText: is there a cast failure possibility?
timeline.author: AayushBhatnagar

replies.bodyText: An issue is that the exception can catch other unwanted exceptions: design will be changed in the future by creating an exception superclass
replies.author: subinbean

timeline.author: AayushBhatnagar

timeline.bodyText: Whats the use of errorLimit variable?
timeline.author: AayushBhatnagar

timeline.bodyText: Please add a //TODO comment that a more robust way to break the input into statements will be implemented in the future. The current code probably works for simple cases, but it doesn't handle comments, or semicolon in strings for example.
timeline.author: feiling

timeline.bodyText: Please add comment describes what command line flags are supported. Also, add some sample usages.
timeline.author: feiling
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,95 @@
+package com.google.bigquery;
+
+import org.apache.commons.cli.*;
+
+import java.io.IOException;
+import java.util.Comparator;
+
+/**
+ * this file is the main file for the command line tool. The first argument is a txt file
+ * containing the queries. The second argument, which is optional, is a time limit that we
+ * impose on processing a single query. The third argument, which is optional, is a file
+ * that we want to write the results to.
+ */

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/tools/query_breakdown/src/main/java/com/google/bigquery/Main.java b/tools/query_breakdown/src/main/java/com/google/bigquery/Main.java
index c8f4b81..0b30ec8 100644
--- a/tools/query_breakdown/src/main/java/com/google/bigquery/Main.java
+++ b/tools/query_breakdown/src/main/java/com/google/bigquery/Main.java

@@ -6,10 +6,16 @@ import java.io.IOException;
 import java.util.Comparator;
 
 /**
- * this file is the main file for the command line tool. The first argument is a txt file
- * containing the queries. The second argument, which is optional, is a time limit that we
- * impose on processing a single query. The third argument, which is optional, is a file
- * that we want to write the results to.
+ * This file is the main file for the command line tool.
+ * Usage: query_breakdown -r <PATH> [-w <PATH>] [-l <INTEGER>]
+ * -i, --input, PATH: this command specifies the path to the file containing queries to be
+ *                    inputted into the tool. It is therefore mandatory
+ * -o, --output, PATH: this command specifies the path to the file that the tool can write
+ *                    its results to. If not specified, the tool will simply print results on the
+ *                    console. It is therefore optional
+ * -l, --limit, PATH: this command specifies the path to an integer that the tool takes as a
+ *                    limit for the number of errors to be explored, thereby controlling the
+ *                    runtime. It is therefore optional
  */
 public class Main {
   public static void main(String[] args) {

timeline.bodyText: What's the purpose of having this comparator?
timeline.author: feiling

replies.bodyText:
The purpose of the comparator is to just order the commands in the order I want it, since the default is alphabetical.
Before: -r -l -w
After: -r -w -l
replies.author: subinbean
